title: About
text: I decided to give this a go as a learning exercise. I’ve been teaching with tmap for a few years. Version 4.0 is in the offing and introduces some major changes, which at first glance make it trickier to teach, and closer in many ways to ggplot2, which I have often considered instead. So… I thought I’d try to make a bunch of maps using both platforms to get a feel for the pros and cons of each.

title: 04 Bad Map
text:
Code
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

title: 04 Bad Map
text:
Data wrangling


Code
sh1 <- st_read("data/sh1.gpkg") %>%
  st_transform(4326) %>%
  select(geom) %>%
  mutate(Mode = "Road")
interislander <- st_read("data/interislander.gpkg") %>%
  st_transform(4326) %>%
  select(geom) %>%
  mutate(Mode = "Boat")
combined <- sh1 %>%
  bind_rows(interislander) %>%
  mutate(Mode = as.factor(Mode))

title: 04 Bad Map
text:
tmap

tm_shape(combined) +
  tm_lines(
    col = "Mode",
    col.scale = tm_scale_categorical(
      values = c("red", "blue"),
      levels = c("Road", "Boat")),
    lty = "Mode",
    lty.scale = tm_scale_categorical(
      values = c("solid", "dashed"),
      levels = c("Road", "Boat")),
    lty.legend = tm_legend_combine("col"),
    lwd = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(
    frame = FALSE,
    legend.frame = FALSE,
    legend.outside = TRUE) +
  tm_compass()

title: 04 Bad Map
text:
ggplot2
Here we need an additional package. ggspatial can do it and seems preferable the not-very-configurable ggsn. The configurability of ggspatial seems a bit over the top for a simple map like this. On the other hand its default north arrow is very on brand for the themes “Bad Map”!

library(ggspatial)

ggplot(combined) +
  geom_sf(aes(colour = Mode, linetype = Mode), linewidth = 0.2) +
  scale_colour_manual(values = c("blue", "red")) +
  scale_linetype_manual(values = c("dotted", "solid")) +
  annotation_north_arrow(location = "br") + 
  theme_void()

title: 01 Points
text: The first three themes (points, lines, areas) all work with the same data. I’m making a meta-point about the somewhat arbitrary nature of geometries in spatial data (a polygon is after all conceputalised as a point set).

title: 01 Points
text:
Libraries


Code
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

title: 01 Points
text:
Data wrangling


Code
w <- 500

nz <- st_read("data/nz.gpkg") %>%
  mutate(Land = TRUE)

bb <- nz %>% 
  st_bbox() %>%
  st_as_sfc() %>%
  st_as_sf(crs = st_crs(nz)) %>%
  st_buffer(w, nQuadSegs = 1) 

shore <- nz %>% 
  st_cast("MULTILINESTRING") %>%
  st_cast("LINESTRING") %>%
  st_buffer(w) %>%
  st_as_sfc() %>%
  st_as_sf(crs = st_crs(nz)) %>%
  mutate(Shore = TRUE)

land <- nz %>%
  st_union() %>%
  st_buffer(w)

water <- bb %>%
  st_difference(land) %>%
  mutate(Water = TRUE)

pts <- bb %>%
  st_sample(250000) %>%
  st_sf() %>%
  st_as_sf(crs = st_crs(nz)) %>%
  st_join(water) %>%
  st_join(nz) %>%
  st_join(shore) %>%
  mutate(Water = replace_na(Water, FALSE),
         Land  = replace_na(Land, FALSE),
         Shore = replace_na(Shore, FALSE),
         What = NA) %>%
  slice(sample(1:n()))

pts[pts$Water, "What"] <- "Water"
pts[pts$Land, "What"] <- "Land"
pts[pts$Shore, "What"] <- "Shore"

pts <- pts %>%
  mutate(What = as.factor(What)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(What))

title: 01 Points
text:
tmap

tm_shape(pts) + 
  tm_bubbles(
    fill = "What",
    fill.scale = tm_scale_categorical(
      values = c("#33aa6660", "#0000ff60", "#bbddff60"),
      levels = c("Land", "Shore", "Water")), 
    size = 0.2,
    lwd = 0) +
  tm_layout(
    frame = FALSE,
    legend.frame = FALSE,
    legend.outside = TRUE)

title: 01 Points
text:
ggplot2

ggplot(pts) +
  geom_sf(aes(colour = What), size = 0.2) +
  scale_colour_manual(values = c("#33aa6660", "#0000ff60", "#bbddff60")) + 
  theme_void()

text:
Code
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(ggplot2)

title: 16 Europe
text:
Data wrangling


Code
focus <- "Europe"
lon0 <- 30
lat0 <- 60
proj <- str_glue("+proj=ortho lon_0={lon0} lat_0={lat0}")




Code
world <- st_read("data/world.gpkg") %>%
  st_make_valid() %>%
  select(CONTINENT)

world_o <- world %>%
  st_transform(proj) %>%
  st_make_valid() %>%
  filter(!st_is_empty(.)) %>%
  group_by(CONTINENT) %>%
  summarise() 

continent <- world %>%
  filter(CONTINENT == focus)

title: 16 Europe
text:
tmap

tm_shape(world_o) +
  tm_fill() + 
  tm_shape(continent) +
  tm_fill(fill = "red") +
  tm_layout(frame = FALSE)

title: 16 Europe
text:
ggplot2

ggplot(world_o) +
  geom_sf(linewidth = 0) +
  geom_sf(
    data = continent, 
    fill = "red", 
    linewidth = 0) +
  theme_void()

title: 07 Navigation
text:
Code
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(dplyr)
library(geosphere)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)

source("utils.R")

title: 07 Navigation
text:
Data wrangling


Code
start_lat <- -41.3
start_lon <- 174.75
end_lat <- 45
ortho_proj <- str_glue("+proj=ortho +lat_0={start_lat} +lon_0={174.75}")
bearing <- -88.5
step_length <- 5e4
last_pt <- c(start_lon, start_lat)
lox <- list()
transect <- last_pt
i <- 1
while (last_pt[2] < end_lat) {
  next_pt <- destPointRhumb(last_pt, bearing, step_length)
  if (next_pt[1] > last_pt[1]) {
    lox[[i]] <- transect
    i <- i + 1
    transect <- c(next_pt)
  } else {
    transect <- c(transect, next_pt)
  }
  last_pt <- next_pt
}
lox[[i]] <- transect

lox_sf <- lox %>%
  lapply(unlist) %>%
  lapply(matrix, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) %>%
  st_multilinestring() %>%
  st_sfc() %>%
  st_sf(crs = 4326) %>%
  st_cast("LINESTRING") %>%
  st_cast("POINT")

data("World")
world <- World %>%
  st_cast("POLYGON") %>%
  st_transform(ortho_proj) %>%
  dplyr::filter(!(st_is_empty(geometry)))

graticule <- c(get_meridians(), get_parallels()) %>%
  st_sfc(crs = 4326) %>%
  st_transform(ortho_proj)

title: 07 Navigation
text:
tmap

tm_shape(world, bbox = lox_sf) +
  tm_fill(fill = "#cccccc", lwd = 0) +
  tm_shape(graticule) +
  tm_lines(col = "grey", lwd = 0.5) +
  tm_shape(lox_sf) +
  tm_dots(fill = "firebrick", size = 0.001) +
  # tm_title("    Go (just north of) west! See also Day 22") +
  tm_layout(frame = FALSE)

title: 07 Navigation
text:
ggplot2

ggplot(world) +
  geom_sf(fill = "#cccccc", linewidth = 0) +
  geom_sf(data = graticule, colour = "grey", linewidth = 0.2) +
  geom_sf(data = lox_sf, colour = "firebrick", size = 0.01) +
  ggtitle("Go (just north of) west! See also Day 22") +
  theme_minimal()

title: 03 Polygons
text:
Data wrangling


Code
nz <- st_read("data/nz.gpkg") %>%
  st_union() %>%
  st_as_sf() %>%
  mutate(What = "Land")

not_nz <- nz %>% 
  st_union() %>%
  st_buffer(500) %>%
  st_bbox() %>%
  st_as_sfc() %>%
  st_as_sf() %>%
  st_difference(nz) %>%
  mutate(What = "Water")

nz_not_nz <- nz %>%
  bind_rows(not_nz) %>%
  mutate(What = as.factor(What))
